Title: SilverTerm
Description: SilverTerm is a fully functioning SSH client written as a Silverlight 4.0 application.  In addition to the full application, the base SilverTerm control will be made available to enable SSH support within existing Silverlight applications.
HomeWiki:
Project Description
SilverTerm is a fully functioning SSH client written as a Silverlight 4.0 application. In addition to the full application, the base SilverTerm control will be made available to enable SSH support within existing Silverlight applications.

History

This project is based off of the SharpSSH2 project located at http://sharpssh2.codeplex.com. The original SharpSSH was developed by Tamir Gal and can located at http://www.tamirgal.com/blog/page/SharpSSH.aspx. The goal of the project is to enable the development of IT and business applications that require SSH communications in a single solution.

Feature List
  • SilverTerm Control
    • Supports SSH2 protocal
    • SSH File Transfer Protocol (SFTP)
    • Key exchange: diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha1, diffie-hellman-group1-sha1
    • Cipher: 3desc-cbc, aes1128-cbc
    • MAC: hmac-md5
    • Host key type: ssh-rsa, ssh-dss
    • Userauth: password, publickey (RSA, DSA)
    • Generating DSA and RSA key paris
    • Changing the passphrase for a private key
    • Self-contained for inclusion in 3rd party applications
    • Slim API for automating logins, operations, etc
  • SilverTerm Application
    • Tabbed multi-session layout
    • Theme support
    • Connection management
    • Central server connection management
